extendedIngredients.name: black olives
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (6 ounces) large black olives, sliced

extendedIngredients.name: coarse salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: coarse salt and fresh black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: green salsa
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups (16 ounces) salsa (I like Green Mountain Gringo or Newman's Own )
metaInformation: (I like Mountain Gringo or Newman's Own )

extendedIngredients.name: jalapeno
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 - 2 tablespoons diced pickled jalapeno or 1 fresh, optional (omit if using a "hot" salsa)

extendedIngredients.name: monterey jack
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup finely shredded cheddar or monterey jack (or a mix), plus more for serving

extendedIngredients.name: oregano
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed between fingertips

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Salsa Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Chehalem INOX Chardonnay with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem INOX Chardonnay
productMatches.description: INOXÂ® takes its name from the abbreviation of the French word for stainless steel, inoxydable. The wine was created differently from most Chardonnay you've had. We think we've succeeded in expressing the crisp, steely, and fruit-rich side that we love about some Old-World Chardonnays. What makes this possible is the use of exclusively Dijon clones, exceptionally well suited to Oregon's cool climate and exhibiting a richness that does not depend on oak. INOX screams of the hallmarks of a cool climate-brightness, pinpoint fruit, and explosive aromas and flavors. We intend INOX for a full range of use, from hot weather chilling to elegant dinner complements.Quintessential INOX, with lovely white aromas of gardenia and other flowers, peach, apricot, pear, pineapple, and green apple candy showing on the nose and palate; it shows a great balance with relatively low alcohol for the year and bright acid; the length is lovely and the weight rich, with a supple, silky texture; flavors linger, with cherry and peach accents. Very pleased.

recipes.instructions: Add the salsa, 1/4 cup water, olives, onions, garlic,  jalapeno, vinegar, chile powder, cumin, oregano and corn, if using, to a 3 - 5 quart crock pot set on high. Mix well.Cut the chicken breasts in half and season well with salt and pepper. Nestle them in the sauce. Cook on high 3 - 4 hours or low 5 - 6. Remove the chicken breasts to a cutting board and shred or chop into bite-sized pieces. Taste and season the sauce with salt and pepper if needed.Mix the chicken back into the sauce with the cheese. If the sauce is watery - cook with the lid off for 15 minutes or so to evaporate some of it off. Serve over cooked rice with extra cheese, sour cream and/or avocado. Or make tacos with your favorite fixings.

steps.step: Add the salsa, 1/4 cup water, olives, onions, garlic,  jalapeno, vinegar, chile powder, cumin, oregano and corn, if using, to a 3 - 5 quart crock pot set on high.
Cut the chicken breasts in half and season well with salt and pepper. Nestle them in the sauce. Cook on high 3 - 4 hours or low 5 - 6.
Remove the chicken breasts to a cutting board and shred or chop into bite-sized pieces. Taste and season the sauce with salt and pepper if needed.
Mix the chicken back into the sauce with the cheese. If the sauce is watery - cook with the lid off for 15 minutes or so to evaporate some of it off.
Serve over cooked rice with extra cheese, sour cream and/or avocado. Or make tacos with your favorite fixings.
